title: Sampler, 1976-100-54, 1823
medium:
Medium: silk on wool
Technique: plain weave foundation; chain, satin, and cross stitching; counted and uncounted stitches
signed: Signed bottom, center: Elizabeth Hanskins Marlborough, December 16 - 1823
provenance: Ex. coll. Fraser-Martin. Bought by Miss Annie Grant at Cambridge, 1924.
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 45.1 x 32.1 cm (17 3/4 x 12 5/8 in.)
creditline: Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection
description: Unfinished sampler.  Sampler has an elaborate floral border of two vines bearing several varieties of exotic flowers (and johnny-jump-ups).  The foliage grows from an urn and culminates at the top as a rose. The center is empty, and it is signed "Elizabeth Hanskins Marlborough, December 16 - 1823" at the bottom.
